Package ohos.agp.utils

Class TextTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.utils.TextTool

  • public class TextTool
extends Object
    A utility class for operating strings or characters.
    Since:
    3

      • isNullOrEmpty

        public static boolean isNullOrEmpty​(CharSequence source)
        Checks whether the source string is empty.
        Parameters:
        source - Indicates the source string to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the string is empty; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • isEqual

        public static boolean isEqual​(CharSequence sourceA,
                              CharSequence sourceB)
        Checks whether the content of string A equals that of string B.
        Parameters:
        sourceA - Indicates the source string A to compare.
        sourceB - Indicates the source string B to compare.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the contents of the two strings are equal; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • isLayoutRightToLeft

        public static boolean isLayoutRightToLeft​(Locale locale)
        Checks whether the text layout of a specified Locale is from right to left.
        Parameters:
        locale - Indicates the locale to check. This parameter can be null.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the layout is from right to left; returns false if the layout is from left to right or if locale is null.
        Since:
        3

      • findChar

        public static int findChar​(CharSequence source,
                           char destChar,
                           int startIndex,
                           int endIndex)
        Finds the index of the destination character from the specified range of the source string.
        Parameters:
        source - Indicates the source string.
        destChar - Indicates the destination character to find.
        startIndex - Indicates the start index of the search range.
        endIndex - Indicates the end index of the search range.
        Returns:
        Returns the index of the destination character if the operation is successful; returns -1 otherwise.
        Since:
        3

        endIndex - Indicates the end index of the search range.
        Returns:

                                  int startIndex,
                                  int endIndex)
        Obtains a new character array based on the specified range of the source string.
        Parameters:
        source - Indicates the source string.
        startIndex - Indicates the start index of the search range.
        endIndex - Indicates the end index of the search range.
        Returns:
        Returns the new character array.

      • subCharArray

        public static void subCharArray​(CharSequence source,
                                int startIndex,
                                int endIndex,
                                char[] destChars,
                                int destIndex)
        Obtains a new character array based on the specified range of the source string and puts the array in a particular position of the destination character array.
        Parameters:
        source - Indicates the source string.
        startIndex - Indicates the start index of the search range.
        endIndex - Indicates the end index of the search range.
        destChars - Indicates the destination character array.
        destIndex - Indicates the start index in the destination character array for putting the obtained array.
        Since:
        3
